top_comments_top.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*

Shit. I lost all respect for the SCOTUS after Citizens United. After a few more rulings and the right's success in packing the court, I now only have contempt. They've shown over and over that they "interpret" the constitution to favor corporations over people.

I fully expect this court to end up overruling Row vs. Wade or find a way of making it moot.

Fucking illegitimate court of dogshit. How do you wonder why people have lost faith in the Supreme Court when the three most recent justices were not only appointed by a president who lost the popular vote; but one sits in a seat that was stolen from the previous president; another is a credibly alleged sexual assaulter who somehow had his massive gambling debts erased by some unknown benefactor shortly before his nomination, taking the seat of another justice who was likely forced out for his son’s Deutsche Bank connections; and the latest is a Federalist Society hack who was shoved down onto the bench two weeks before an election, utterly contradicting the bullshit standard that was created for Gorsuch. All of them pushed onto the bench on party line votes.

We’re going to be lorded over for decades now by a Supreme Court that wasn’t just packed with zealots, it was bought by dark money to be a dollar menu for foregone rulings on everything you can imagine.
Don’t want an abortion. Don’t get one. Problem solved. Yay!

top_comments_best.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*

Shit. I lost all respect for the SCOTUS after Citizens United. After a few more rulings and the right's success in packing the court, I now only have contempt. They've shown over and over that they "interpret" the constitution to favor corporations over people.

I fully expect this court to end up overruling Row vs. Wade or find a way of making it moot.

There is waning trust for all branches of government. Republicans don't trust the government at all because of tentacle monsters in vaccines. They only trust Trump, which is laughable considering how dishonest he is. Democrats are losing trust because even though they control the White House and Congress, they don't deliver on promises. I don't know why anyone would trust the Supreme Court, since they have been making decisions on pure politics for a long time. They simply don't side with the interest of actual people and their rights.
    
Then again, what does it matter if people are losing trust in the Supreme Court? Why are any of them bothering to try to convince us they aren't partisan hacks? It's not like they have to answer for their decisions. They aren't held accountable when they step on people's rights, since they can stay in there until they die if they want. At least other politicians have to run for reelection, which occasionally they lose (although not often).
The public isn't divided on abortion at all. People overwhelmingly want it.
